alert.note: Alert for Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 6:13AM EDT until June 20 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory In Effect for much of Patrick County until 1115 AM EDT this morning... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Patrick. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams across the region. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 612 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain persisting in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Grays Fork, Dodd Creek, Joint Crack Creek, Anglin Branch, Ivy Creek, Crooked Creek, Jacks Creek, Elk Creek, Goblintown Creek, Howell Creek, Hughes Creek, Koger Creek, Blackberry Creek, Bull Mountain Fork and Dan River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stuart... Woolwine... Buffalo Ridge... Patrick Springs... Charity... Critz... Rocky Knob Recreation Area... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
